original: Åhlund, Nils Jonas, disponent, Göteborg, f. 28/1/97 i Gbg av överste Gustaf Å. o. Sigrid Kjellberg. G. 21 m. Ulla Wilkens. Barn: Inga f. 22, g. Philipson, Margareta 23, g. Lothigius. — Stud:ex. 14, res:off:ex. 16, ekon. ex. v. hand :höigsk, i Sthlm 19. Res. t. Engl., Tyskl., Frankr., Ungern, HolL, Belg. o. USA 23-48. Tj :m:an i Esselte 19-20’, kont:chef i Sthlms Kartong- & Litogr. A-B 20-22, dir:assist. i Esselte 22-27, disp. i Sv. Bokhand :centr. 27-31, i Esseke 31-40’ verkst. dir. i Bengtsons LitOigr. A-B 38-40, i Esseltes Gbgsind. A-B, Gustaf Melins A-B, Wezäta-Gbgslitogr. A-B o. A-B Esselte Kartonnage i Gbg sed. 40. Ordf. i styr. f. Hugo Brusewitz A-B, A-B Borås Tryckeri & Kartongfabr., A-B Konsumenttjänst, Gbgs reklamfören. 42, Sv. boktr:fören. o. Sv. boktr:-fören. kreditkassa, led. av styr. f. Gbgs högerförb.. Sv. reklamförb., Bo-husl. företagarefören. (suppl.), Philip Holmqvists hand:inst., Gbgs boktr:-fören., Sv:es tr>xk. arb :giv :förb., Sv:es bokbinderiidk. arb :giv :förb., 167/ Gbgs ’konserthus, Sv. reklam- o. försäljn :kont., suppl. i styr. f. Företagsekon. fören. o. Sv:es grafiska indiförb., fullm. i Gbgs hand:-kamm., led. av styr. f. Grafiska inst., led. av Int. boktr :rådet o. Nord. boktr :rådet, v. ordf. i Sv. lawn-tennisförb. 41-44. Sv. mäst. i lawn-tennis 18. Skr.: Boktryckeriets administration (i Hantv. bok), art. i fackfrågor. GV:sJmt, RVO, Sv. gymn:-o. idrifören. riksförb. ftjt., Sv. lawn-tennisförb. ftj :plak.
translated: Åhlund, Nils Jonas, manager, Gothenburg, b. January 28, 1897 in Gothenburg, son of Colonel Gustaf Å. and Sigrid Kjellberg. Married since 1921 to Ulla Wilkens. Children: Inga b. 1922, married Philipson, Margareta b. 1923, married Lothigius. — Completed high school in 1914, completed reserve officer examination in 1916, graduated with a degree in economics from Stockholm School of Economics in 1919. Traveled to England, Germany, France, Hungary, the Netherlands, Belgium, and the USA from 1923 to 1948. Worked at Esselte from 1919 to 1920, as head of the accounting department at Stockholm Carton & Litography AB from 1920 to 1922, as director's assistant at Esselte from 1922 to 1927, as manager at the Swedish Bookseller Central from 1927 to 1931, as managing director at Bengtsons Litography AB from 1938 to 1940, and at Esselte's Gothenburg Industries AB, Gustaf Melin AB, Wezäta-Gothenburg Litography AB, and AB Esselte Kartonnage in Gothenburg since 1940. Chairman of the board for Hugo Brusewitz AB, AB Borås Printing and Carton Factory, AB Consumer Service, Gothenburg Advertising Association in 1942, Swedish Printing Association and Swedish Printing Association Credit Fund, member of the board for Gothenburg Right Federation, Swedish Advertising Association, Bohuslän Entrepreneurs Association (suppl.), Philip Holmqvist's Business Institute, Gothenburg Printing Association, Swedish Printing Employers' Association, Swedish Bookbinding Employers' Association, Gothenburg Concert Hall, Swedish Advertising and Sales Control, member of the board for Business Economics Association and Swedish Graphic Industry Association, proxy in the Gothenburg Chamber of Commerce, member of the board for Graphic Institute, member of International Printing Council and Nordic Printing Council, vice chairman of Swedish Lawn Tennis Federation from 1941 to 1944. Swedish champion in lawn tennis in 1918. Writings: Administration of Printing (in Craftsman's Book), articles on specialized topics. Awarded GV:sJmt, RVO, Swedish Gymnastics and Sports Federation ftjt., Swedish Lawn Tennis Federation ftj:plak.

occupation.namedPosition: Esselte's Gothenburg Industries AB, Gustaf Melin AB, Wezäta-Gothenburg Litography AB, AB Esselte Kartonnage
